fields.description: When you transfer the ownership of a private repository owned by a regular user to a team account. It does not create the rights for each user to see it. It does however show an extra repository in the repository counts for team member dashboards.
fields.summary: Transferring ownership of personal repo to Team user

fields.description:
I've already sent an email to support@bitbucket.org about this but nobody answers. I'm using Windows Azure deployment from bitbucket, but the operation fails with the following error: abort: abandoned transaction found - run hg recover!\\
I read that this is as simple for you to solve as running the command on my repository.\\
https://bitbucket.org/reinderbrouwer/raadio
fields.summary: abort: abandoned transaction found - run hg recover!

fields.description:
There seems to be a new event type that has completely replaced the event type of "commit" with zero documentation on how to decipher it. Please consider the following output:

{code}
    {
        "node": null,
        "description": "(dp0\nS'total_commits'\np1\nI2\nsS'commits'\np2\n(lp3\n(dp4\nS'hash'\np5\nV371edaee4b3b51c484e37ea4054b66d89da73e15\np6\nsS'description'\np7\nS'New Wiki Event & Wiki path forward slash check'\np8\nsa(dp9\ng5\nV5d0c13555805f1a6471ba5232c7fcea64d661826\np10\nsg7\nS'Fixed issue with Wiki. Missing forward slash in path'\np11\nsas.",
        "repository": {
            "scm": "git",
            "has_wiki": true,
            "last_updated": "2013-04-04 01:29:15",
            "creator": null,
            "created_on": "2012-06-05 01:58:10",
            "owner": "thedillonb",
            "logo": "https://d3oaxc4q5k2d6q.cloudfront.net/m/0a8a7e292790/img/language-avatars/c_sharp_16.png",
            "email_mailinglist": "",
            "is_mq": false,
            "size": 31886172,
            "read_only": false,
            "fork_of": null,
            "mq_of": null,
            "followers_count": 1,
            "state": "available",
            "utc_created_on": "2012-06-04 23:58:10+00:00",
            "website": "http://www.dillonbuchanan.com/",
            "description": "A Monotouch project for Bitbucket",
            "has_issues": true,
            "is_fork": false,
            "slug": "bitbucketbrowser",
            "is_private": true,
            "name": "BitbucketBrowser",
            "language": "c#",
            "utc_last_updated": "2013-04-03 23:29:15+00:00",
            "email_writers": true,
            "no_public_forks": false,
            "resource_uri": "/1.0/repositories/thedillonb/bitbucketbrowser"
        },
        "created_on": "2013-03-16 17:12:31",
        "user": {
            "username": "thedillonb",
            "first_name": "Dillon",
            "last_name": "",
            "display_name": "thedillonb",
            "is_team": false,
            "avatar": "https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/5ce4051edf2dd7a41c0d9f438f869b1a?d=https%3A%2F%2Fd3oaxc4q5k2d6q.cloudfront.net%2Fm%2F0a8a7e292790%2Fimg%2Fdefault_avatar%2F32%2Fuser_blue.png&s=32",
            "resource_uri": "/1.0/users/thedillonb"
        },
        "utc_created_on": "2013-03-16 16:12:31+00:00",
        "event": "pushed"
    },
{code}

What is the encoding used to construct the "description" field which looks like it has embedded values in it. Also, with these kinds of changes, why are they being delivered to the 1.0 API interface? Why not put non-backwards compatible changes into the 2.0 version of the API?
fields.summary: REST API: Event Type "pushed"

fields.description:
In the commit history the 'Date' column shows 'x days ago' up to a month ago. This quickly (beyond a day or two ago) gets very unhelpful, 21 days ago makes much less sense that Feb-22. While I can hover over each date individually to get the date, this is fiddly and means they have to be checked one at a time.

Switching to a date for anything before yesterday, or even up to five days ago would be much easier to interpret.
fields.summary: Better commit date format when older than N days (BB-8076)

fields.description:
Hey guys,\\
your favicon.ico got lost:

https://bitbucket.org/favicon.ico

Cheers!\\
Max
fields.summary: favicon.ico gone on bitbucket.org

fields.description:
As time goes by, there are more and more duplicate "Fisheye key" entries in the deployment keys for each repository.  There should only be a single Fisheye key (or at most a few) and not duplicates for certain.

Example: vgtf / cookbook-ids-base
fields.summary: There are 100's of duplicate deployment keys in the vgtf repositories

fields.description:
Much like how GitHub does it: display an "Edit" button at source file views. Clicking it brings up an inline editor that you can use to edit the source file in-place. Saving the file creates a commit to the repository, or if you don't have enough privileges to push to the repo then create a fork and commit to that.

You can also think about this as generalizing the Wiki. Practically the Wiki would be a repo that has Markdown compiling support in addition to the standard repositories.

What do you think?
fields.summary: Feature request: Inline editing for source files
Using `code` in link text generates invalid HTML (BB-8072)

fields.description: As in title. See attachments.

fields.description:
When I search for reviewers when creating new pull requests, it searches all users, not the sensible choices of:

* Users who have access to the repository
* Team members

Doesn't really make sense to add global users who wouldn't have permission to view the repo to a PR (which you can't do, of course, but I shouldn't have to filter them out when typing)

Wrong result for src "raw" Bitbucket API call

The pull request can no longer be declined using the site UI.

I am using TeamCity to build my private repository and everything is working fine.\\
Now, I want to test pull requests before they are merged to master.\\
I followed this link http://hadihariri.com/tag/oss/ which uses a github repository.\\
However, it does not seem to work.\\
The author mentions that "When a pull request is made, GitHub automatically creates a reference that holds the pull request as well as one that is a merge with the master branch"

Is this the same is bitbucket? So if I use "+:refs/pull/_/head" or "+:refs/pull/(_/merge)" it should work?

fields.description:
Hey folks,

I'm unable to do a git pull on a server in Canada from your service via ssh or https. I get the following errors:

SSH:\\
git pull origin master\\
ssh: Could not resolve hostname bitbucket.org: Temporary failure in name resolution\\
fatal: The remote end hung up unexpectedly

HTTPS:\\
git pull livehttp master\\
error: Couldn't resolve host 'bitbucket.org' while accessing https://richardtape@bitbucket.org/richardtape/spes-live.git/info/refs\\
fatal: HTTP request failed

My remotes are set up as following:\\
git remote -v\\
livehttp	https://richardtape@bitbucket.org/richardtape/spes-live.git (fetch)\\
livehttp	https://richardtape@bitbucket.org/richardtape/spes-live.git (push)\\
origin	ssh://git@bitbucket.org/richardtape/spes-live.git (fetch)\\
origin	ssh://git@bitbucket.org/richardtape/spes-live.git (push)

Errm... help?
fields.summary: error: Couldn't resolve host 'bitbucket.org' while accessing...

fields.description:
I'm not going to lie, the only feature that really keeps me going back to github, is that my profile shows my activity across all repositories (even ones that are not mine).

The reason I like this, is because I can share this profile with potential employers and they can see all of my activity (even though, i don't have a lot of repositories myself).

It still kind of sucks though, because I really wish that it would show every public commit that belongs to me across every repository on the network, that would be really slick.
fields.summary: Activity on Profile

fields.description: People have started to write documentation directly as part of the repos, as .md documents in the repo directory hierarchy. In GitHub, you can have an url that always gives you the most recent version of the file. Here in Bitbucket, you can only get an url that points to a specific commit, so the url gets outdated when new commits arrive.
fields.summary: Cannot link to most recent version of .md documents (BB-8068)

{code}
#!Shell

$ git clone https://bitbucket.org/KPsN/trinitycore-243
Cloning into 'trinitycore-243'...
fatal: https://bitbucket.org/KPsN/trinitycore-243/info/refs?service=git-upload-p
ack not found: did you run git update-server-info on the server?

$ git clone ssh://hg@bitbucket.org/KPsN/trinitycore-243
Cloning into 'trinitycore-243'...
conq: not a git repository.
fatal: Could not read from remote repository.

Please make sure you have the correct access rights
and the repository exists.
{code}

Ok, second try: i clone the repository to my account, configure git and verify:

{code}
#!Shell

$ ssh -T git@bitbucket.org
conq: logged in as ChazyTheBest.

You can use git or hg to connect to Bitbucket. Shell access is disabled.
{code}

Logged in gives the same error...

fields.description:
We created an account and added an email two days later.  Resend of the confirmation does not work.  When you click the link that it emails out it says the link has expired, despite the fact that it just sent the link 30 seconds prior.  Repeated attempts yield the same result.

"This account has an unconfirmed email address. If you haven't received a confirmation, visit the email page to resend it."
fields.summary: Broken e-mail confirmation

fields.description:
Some kind of key fetch/validation mechanism would be ideal, but PGP signatures should be handled a bit better regardless to prevent the UX impairment they currently cause. I've attached a screenshot, and messages attached to signed commits can't be viewed in list mode - you have to navigate to the commit page to see the text after the PGP block (see "removed favicon" in the second screenshot).

This can be recreated by having GPG installed locally and running "git commit -S ....".

Github appears to have hacked around this by discarding the PGP block when showing comments - eg. it would show "removed favicon" in commit list view rather than "gpgsig -----BEGIN PGP SIGNATURE-----".
fields.summary: Better handling of PGP signed comments (BB-8050)

fields.description:
I can't make pull requests, i keep seeing a 500 error. I checked in Chrome Developer Tools and saw this on the 500 error page in the response, hopefully this helps identify the problem:

9380834b0ac34271a7a980e7173b75aa$902b284ba47444289b5eb9328c4c73f3

fields.description:
From time to time I need to push some code from work, and I would like to be able to setup a my-work-ssh-keypair with write access to specified repo or two. I don't want to expose my main ssh key there, to limit possible access.

Would be great if I could do so, even if each such deploy-with-WRITE-key take one private collaborator slot. That would be superb feature. at this very moment I would need to setup new account, like myname_work and add it as private collaborator, thats kind of lame to just create more usernames just to do it.
fields.summary: Additional read-WRITE key per repository basis (BB-8051)

fields.description: The word _follow_ is translated to _下面的_, which is incorrect.It should be _关注_ or something else.
fields.summary: Translation issue

fields.description:
I use Bitbucket with a custom domain to share with my clients.

Now, when i go to http://bitbucket.org/*username/repo-name/issues* and select an issue and click on any changeset hash, it works perfectly and takes me to the relevant commit

However, when I repeat this with http://*my-domain/repo-name*/issues it gives me a 404.

This is because the changeset now points to http://bitbucket.org, instead of http://*my-domain*, making the link http://bitbucket.org/*repo-name*/commits/*hash* instead of http://*my-domain/repo-name*/commits/*hash* or http://bitbucket.org/*username/repo-name*/commits/*hash*

Given these inconsistencies, I believe that these links are generated dynamically, hence fixable :smiley:
fields.summary: Inconsistent changeset hash links URIs (BB-8291)

When trying to push changes to the repo raymii/book I get the following error in my terminal:

{code}
#!python

remy at gateway in ~/repo/ansibook (master)
$ git push
Counting objects: 7, done.
Delta compression using up to 4 threads.
Compressing objects: 100% (4/4), done.
Writing objects: 100% (4/4), 52.26 KiB, done.
Total 4 (delta 0), reused 0 (delta 0)
remote: Traceback (most recent call last):
remote:   File "/opt/python/domains/bitbucket.org/current/bitbucket/scripts/git/hooks/pre-receive", line 16, in <module>
remote:     from bitbucket.apps.repo2.hooks import prehooks

remote:     from bitbucket.apps.repo2.featurebranches import FeatureBranchesNotAvailable
remote: ImportError: cannot import name managedrepo
To ssh://git@bitbucket.org/raymii/book.git
 ! [remote rejected] master -> master (pre-receive hook declined)
error: failed to push some refs to 'ssh://git@bitbucket.org/raymii/book.git'
{code}

I get this since yesterday evening, and still have it. This is my git version:\\
$ git --version\\
git version 1.7.12.4 (Apple Git-37)

Running on OS X 10.8 with macports.
fields.summary: remote: ImportError: cannot import name managedrepo

Hi,

a friend commited a change and I wanted to comment on a specific line,\\
the comment editor shows up, but when I hit "Comment" a small loading circle\\
appears but nothing happens.

Tested with Chrome and IE10.
fields.summary: I can't comment on individual lines in a commit.

fields.description:
We use the "Email Diff" service on many of our mercurial repos.  It seems like this service is misbehaving when there are very lagre commits (e.g., MB or GB in size -- I don't know what the minimum size is to exhibit this problem).  If we do a push a up to our mercurial bitbucket that includes a very large commit, one of two things will happen:

# If we are pushing up multiple commits to bitbucket simultaneously, this very large commit will not be shown in the "Email Diff" email at all.  The other commit diffs will be shown, but not the very large commit.
# If we are pushing just the single, very large commit, we get an email diff back saying:

0 new commits in <repo name>:
fields.summary: Large pushes result in strange email diff mails (BB-8041)

fields.description:
When you reference an issue in a pull request (in the description, or in a comment) there should be added some kind of reference to the pull request to that issue.

For example a comment or note saying:

"User foo referenced this issue in pull request XXXX".

The user and pull request should of course be clickable links.

Currently if I create a pull request and reference an issues, I have to go to the issue and add the comment/link myself to inform all people involved of the pull request.
fields.summary: Two-way links between issues and pull requests (BB-8037)

fields.description:
Hi Devs,

It would be awesome if you supported Mozilla Persona (https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/persona) for account logins - would make our interactions with contract development teams a lot easier if signup/signin only required an email address.

Kind Regards,\\
Adon
fields.summary: Mozilla Persona for login (BB-8036)

fields.description:

Maybe if every comment has an ID I can use it as a link, this is similar to posts in forums.

Thanks
fields.summary: Reference to comment or link to a comment
Overview (and source) need CSS for RST admonition directives (BB-8038)

fields.description:
Hi there,

The guides at https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Writing+Brokers+for+Bitbucket are a great start, but for non-python devs, they aren't as clear as a packaged working example would be.

Given the brokers are provided under OSI-approved licenses it seems like it shouldn't be too much of a logistical effort to publish a repository of brokers.

GitHub does this (https://github.com/github/github-services) and it lowers the barrier to entry for contributing to GitHub in a big way.

I'd like to write a broker for our app for BitBucket, but the docs aren't enough to have a clear understanding of how to do this.  GitHub made it simple, so we'll integrate with them first (sucks since we use BitBucket, not GitHub, and dog-food our own app, so that integration would be sweet!).

Thanks,

Michael
fields.summary: Open source existing service brokers to help us get started writing new ones (BB-8035)

fields.description:
It would be super handing if there was a quick way to claim an issue (assign to self) from the main issues page.

The current process of opening the issue, clicking edit, choosing yourself seems more clicks than necessary.

I logged a few days ago on bitbucket, on my computer, using openid. Today I was able to delete permanently a repository without proving my identity. Maybe you could add a password check in this case ?

Regards,

At https://bitbucket.org/kbecker/pshdl/wiki/tutorial\\
I want to document my own programming language. Unfortunately I can not get any useful syntax highlighting done. The problem is that if I don't specify any language, it is guessed. This means that something wrong is guessed as this language is not known to pygments yet. Unfortunately I also can not create my own <pre> blocks or other formatting options like span.\\
It would be awesome to:

* attach custom CSS and styles to code
* disable the automatic language guessing

Karsten

I've got Chrome  25.0.1364.172 (OS X).

fields.description:
Hi Bitbucket team,

at the moment I'm playing around with the import from an existing SVN repository. This is located on Sourceforge currently (here: https://daps.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/daps/).

After I've filled all the fields in the "Import existing code" page, I've got this error message:

{code}
#!
[...]
09:03:16 Done
09:03:16 Subversion checkout successful
09:03:16 Creating new hg repository...
09:03:17 Unable to convert svn checkout to hg
09:03:18 Svn checkout failed: <type 'exceptions.KeyError'>: None
{code}

(See the full messages here: [https://bitbucket.org/repo/import/121613|https://bitbucket.org/repo/import/121613]).

I've tried it both with "Subversion" or "Sourceforge" as source, nothing worked. Not sure what I can do to convince the importer. (The error message looks like a Python exception. ;) )

Hope this helps. Thanks for all your efforts! :)
fields.summary: Import Failed from Subversion/Sourceforge with KeyError Exception

fields.description: For example, https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/jira/commits/42afd709b571230cbe9d60fa3a090ac8f840c191?at=atlassian_jira_6_0_OD_10_release_branch -- the commit is present on the "atlassian_jira_6_0_OD_10_release_branch" branch, but the branch shows up as either emtpy or "OD10". This is because before being pushed to the release branch, it had been erroneously pushed to a new branched called "OD10". That branch was deleted shortly afterward, but not before bitbucket had a chance to index and cache it.
fields.summary: Reindex commit branches when a branch is (forcefully) renamed or deleted (BB-8026)

fields.description:
Сегодня был получен результат по передаче команд управления УМК\БАФ. При подаче тестовой команды на запись в регистр по UART получаем в ответ точно такую же посылку (см. фото). Однако тестовая прошивка выдает при получении ответа ошибки, причем то одну то другую строго по очереди (см. принтскрин). Причем в одной из ошибок проблема с CRC - полученное значение не равно посчитанному, при этом эти значение никогда не меняются 100 и D13A соответственно, даже если я меняю данные посылаемые в посылке. Проблема в приеме ответа похоже, потому что при смене передаваемых данных CRC меняется и УМК на эту посылку отвечает с таким же CRC как и пришло.

Составил Макаров Дмитрий
fields.summary: Управление УМК\БАФ

fields.summary: account display (BB-7997)

fields.description:
Hello,

When I try to upload a file via a custom domain (repo.sulgaming.com), I get a error (see screenshot).
fields.summary: Problem during uploading a file from a custom domain (BB-8025)

fields.description: I was able to watch my soaps on CBS Friday the 22nd of March. When I tried to watch Monday and Tuesday episodes I received a notice in their video player that something was preventing the playing of the video and they speculated it to be an adblock add on. I decided to disable Adblock Edge and refresh the video player page and sure enough I was able to watch my videos from start to finish. Help please. I don't really want to keep disabled Edge just to watch video at CBS. I checked with ABC website and was able to watch video with out any problem. It seems to only be CBS. I'm not a geek techie person at all.
fields.summary: Unable to view video at CBS website

fields.description:
Hello,

For binary files, it would make sense to allow people to make a comment on the file (since there are no lines), for example to point an issue in the file name or the file content itself (especially if it’s an image: we can see the content right here).

I’ve worked around this by putting the comment on the last line of the file before, but 1) I was lucky that this image was preceded by a text file, 2) it does not appear near the image in the activity tab, 3) the comment was banished to the somewhat impractical “comments on previous diff” popup after the text file was updated.
fields.summary: Unable to add comment to binary file in pull request

fields.description:
My personal bitbucket account is also tied to my actual work repositories. I'd like to be able to set it so that repositories from my team get routed to my work e-mail account while other repository notifications would go to my personal account

This references a comment on the documentation page: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Setting+Email+Preferences
fields.summary: Route e-mail based on repo (BB-8002)

fields.description: There appears to be a bug in the teams filter on the dashboard that will show some issues for a team.
fields.summary: You shouldn't see issues for repos you follow in the teams filter (BB-7993)

fields.description: Is it possible to use bit bucket do subdomain i.e "kuchalskis.bitbucket.org" for external websites? I want to use my bit bucket account subdomain for blogger.
fields.summary: Using bit bucket domain for external websites

fields.description:
Hi, I am unable to disable email notifications for the issue trackers associated with my group's repositories.

* I have unticked "email noficiations" under my group's "account settings"
* My team members have unticked "email noficiations" under their user's "account settings"
* There are no email addresses in the "notifications" section of my repositories' settings
* My teammates are not following the repositories in which I am creating issues

and yet, every time I create an issue, they each get an email telling them "This is an issue notification from bitbucket.org. You are receiving this either because you are the owner of the issue, or you are following the issue", which isn't the case.

Any idea where this might be coming from?
fields.summary: Unable to disable email notifications on issues (BB-7989)

fields.description:
I just pushed my commits to bitbucket.\\
I can see those commits in my "Recent Activities" and also in "Dashboard"\\
But when I click on it. Its shows 404.

Also "Commits" tab does not show those (recently pushed) commits.

Feel free to access my account to verify this.
fields.summary: Commits are visible in "Recent Activity" but shows 404 when clicked

fields.description:
Users without access to repository can see my commits in the Dashboard but cannot click through to the repository.

Why does it show them my commits :S
fields.summary: Users without repository access see commits on their dashboard

fields.description:
I use bitbucket wiki content via JSONP, but most likely because of missing or wrong 'Content-Type' header, response is blocked by IE9 or IE10.

Example error in IE10:

SEC7112: Script from https://api.bitbucket.org/1.0/repositories/azhdanov/jiratimesheet/wiki/Overview?callback=jQuery164015784368472568788_1364322943216&_=1364323072021 was blocked due to mime type mismatch\\
www.jiratimesheet.com

Can be reproduced at http://www.jiratimesheet.com/#/wiki/Overview in IE10

See also relevant Stack Overflow problem: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/5986772/ie9-script-response-blocked-due-to-mime-type-mismatch

Can this be fixed, please?
fields.summary: REST API response blocked due to mime type mismatch in IE9+ (BB-7966)

fields.description:
_The translation process is going well._

h1. Add a language selector ?
I think it would be great to allow to change the language *without* being logged in ?

Many website know how to adjust their language by looking on the browser setting, maybe something like that could be added to bitbucket ?

Cheers,

--

Lilian Besson, lbesson on bitbucket.org
fields.summary: Language selector when not authenticated (BB-7959)

fields.description: When setting an alternative commit message encoding, Git places an encoding header in the commit message. The implementation of Git on Bitbucket isn't respecting this and incorrectly displaying characters from commit messages.
fields.summary: Git encoding header is not respected when displaying commit messages on the site (BB-7936)

Hey when can we expect Packagist.org support?   It's definitely a dealbreaker for us, we'll be forced to move to github.

Seriously, it can't be that hard.
